rename.from: Typed routes return type for route handlers is overly restrictive
rename.to: Next.js return type for route handlers is overly restrictive

body:
After upgrading to 15.5, I get the error:

```
Type error: Type 'typeof import("/myapp/pages/api/test")' does not satisfy the expected type 'ApiRouteConfig'.
The types of 'config.api.responseLimit' are incompatible between these types.
Type 'boolean' is not assignable to type 'string | number | undefined'.
Next.js build worker exited with code: 1 and signal: null
```

When I do:

```
export const config = {
  api: {
    responseLimit: false,
  },
}
```

even though this is in the docs?

issue.title: fix: update the config.api.responseLimit type
issue.body:
`config.api.responseLimit` can also be [set to `false`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/82842#issuecomment-3207638164). Because of the limitations of type inference on JS files, we need to set the type to `boolean`.

See https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/82842#issuecomment-3207638164

issue.title: fix: update validation return types
issue.body:
I updated the return type of API routes and route handlers from

```ts
Promise<Response> | Response | Promise<void> | void
```

to 

```ts
Promise<Response | void> | Response | void
```

which fixes #82842.

body:
Hi,

My pipeline just failed trying to update to 15.5, i think it is the same problem.

Here is my error.

```txt
   Linting and checking validity of types ...
Failed to compile.

Type error: Type 'typeof import("/home/runner/work/saas-starter/saas-starter/apps/app/src/app/(dashboard)/dashboard/[[...plugins]]/layout")' does not satisfy the expected type 'LayoutConfig<"/dashboard/[[...plugins]]">'.
  Types of property 'default' are incompatible.
    Type '({ children, ...props }: LayoutProps) => Promise<Element>' is not assignable to type 'ComponentType<LayoutProps<"/dashboard/[[...plugins]]">> | ((props: LayoutProps<"/dashboard/[[...plugins]]">) => void | Promise<void> | ReactNode | Promise<...>)'.
      Type '({ children, ...props }: LayoutProps) => Promise<Element>' is not assignable to type 'FunctionComponent<LayoutProps<"/dashboard/[[...plugins]]">>'.
        Types of parameters '__0' and 'props' are incompatible.
          Type 'LayoutProps<"/dashboard/[[...plugins]]">' is not assignable to type 'LayoutProps'.
            Types of property 'params' are incompatible.
              Type 'Promise<{ plugins?: string[] | undefined; }>' is not assignable to type 'Promise<{ plugins: string[]; }>'.
                Type '{ plugins?: string[] | undefined; }' is not assignable to type '{ plugins: string[]; }'.
                  Types of property 'plugins' are incompatible.
                    Type 'string[] | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string[]'.
                      Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string[]'.
```

Thanks a great work!

Regards,
Javier

@billyjanitsch, @jim-spr, @khalilsarwari, and @jsa4000 -- should be fixed now with [15.5.1-canary.1](https://www.npmjs.com/package/next/v/15.5.1-canary.1)! Let me know if it doesn't solve the problem.

issue.title: TypeScript errors in Next.js 15.5
issue.body:
`route.ts`:
```tsx
export { enableDraftHandler as GET } from '@contentful/vercel-nextjs-toolkit/app-router';
```

this compiles fine with Next.js 15.4.2, but fails with Next.js 15.5.0: 

```
Failed to compile.

Type error: Type 'typeof import(".../src/app/api/enable-draft/route")' does not satisfy the expected type 'RouteHandlerConfig<"/api/enable-draft">'.
  The types returned by 'GET(...)' are incompatible between these types.
    Type 'Promise<void | Response>' is not assignable to type 'void | Response | Promise<Response> | Promise<void>'.
      Type 'Promise<void | Response>' is not assignable to type 'Promise<Response>'.
        Type 'void | Response' is not assignable to type 'Response'.
          Type 'void' is not assignable to type 'Response'.

Next.js build worker exited with code: 1 and signal: null
```

body: @bgub I confirm that [15.5.1-canary.1](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/releases/tag/v15.5.1-canary.1) fixed the issue. Could you please release the fix sooner, otherwise it's breaking apps using Auth.js 5.x
